text:
Ok, I know we do not have a ton of time left but I think it would be a great opportunity for outreach and fun to do a Birds of a Feather JuliaCon event to chat about streaming. I am a bit low on time this week leading up to the submission date for JuliaCon but I could help with organizing/stubbing out a proposal. Would anyone be willing to help with writing the proposal this upcoming week?

Pinging some past and present streamers that come to mind if interested (apologies if I am forgetting folks): <@U6771NKS6>, <@U6QGE7S86>, <@U7K185TUN>, <@U85LVSQ4U>, <@UBVKC24EA>, <@U01FR2HFJ7M>, <@UGP091Z9S> <@U82RE6STE>,

Pinging some past and present streamers that come to mind if interested (apologies if I am forgetting folks):

text: This sounds cool but - what's in the proposal?

elements.text: This sounds cool but - what's in the proposal?

text: Hey <@U6QGE7S86>, here would be what goes in the talk:

elements.text: Hey
, here would be what goes in the talk:

text: Birds of feather sessions are breakout sessions for organized discussions around specific topics. For example, package maintainers can use these times to organize a meeting with and recruit contributors, or community members can organize discussion groups for Julia teaching materials or diversity recruitment. These sessions will be allocated a one hour timeslot, and will not be recorded.

elements.text: Birds of feather sessions are breakout sessions for organized discussions around specific topics. For example, package maintainers can use these times to organize a meeting with and recruit contributors, or community members can organize discussion groups for Julia teaching materials or diversity recruitment. These sessions will be allocated a one hour timeslot, and will not be recorded.
And here are the criteria:

text:
1. *Applicability to the Julia community.* Would users of Julia be interested in this talk for either its methods or its results? Higher scoring proposals should be of wide interest to Julia users.
2. *Contributions to the community.* Is this a new package for people to use? Higher scoring proposals should be code or ideas that others can use.
3. *Clarity.* What is the purpose of this talk? What will people learn? Higher scoring proposals should be clear as to their purpose.
4. *Significance to the community.* Is this something that will change the way a lot of other people use Julia or its package ecosystem? Higher scoring proposals should be more significant to Julia users. Note that this does not require scientific significance, just significance as a software or tutorial to users of Julia.
5. *Topic diversity.* As a community we value the diversity of applications. Proposals which are targeting new areas and fields for the Julia community to expand should be given some credit.
6. *Soundness.* Proposals should be technically sound. Glaring incorrectness should be highlighted and taken into account. 
7. *Classification.* The criteria will be stricter for longer presentations.

elements.text: Applicability to the Julia community.
Would users of Julia be interested in this talk for either its methods or its results? Higher scoring proposals should be of wide interest to Julia users.
Contributions to the community.
Is this a new package for people to use? Higher scoring proposals should be code or ideas that others can use.
Clarity.
What is the purpose of this talk? What will people learn? Higher scoring proposals should be clear as to their purpose.
Significance to the community.

Is this something that will change the way a lot of other people use Julia or its package ecosystem? Higher scoring proposals should be more significant to Julia users. Note that this does not require scientific significance, just significance as a software or tutorial to users of Julia.
Topic diversity.
As a community we value the diversity of applications. Proposals which are targeting new areas and fields for the Julia community to expand should be given some credit.
Soundness.
Proposals should be technically sound. Glaring incorrectness should be highlighted and taken into account.
Classification.
The criteria will be stricter for longer presentations.

text: I'm all for it! I have a lot of proposals to write this year, so my schedule is tight, but I will be happy to discuss and help as much as possible

elements.text: I'm all for it! I have a lot of proposals to write this year, so my schedule is tight, but I will be happy to discuss and help as much as possible

text: if many can help without much time, it might be worth it to create a shared doc so that many can make small additions

text: That's a great thought <@U82RE6STE>! Making one to share right now.

text:
Hey all, I created a Google Doc for the proposal we can write for the Birds of a Feather Live streaming talk; here is the link:

<https://docs.google.com/document/d/1LMt38p_PJkcdiOvanasCQP3L-XBup9B4iDFM3LRcPbQ/edit?usp=sharing>

Read the first page for instructions on where to contribute if you are a streamer or not a streamer. Thanks all! Looking forward to putting something together! :smile:
